# We had Pierce Brown on our Podcast!

My friends and I got to sit down with Pierce Brown and talk to him about the chilling Docks of Ganymede scene from Morning Star. We are the Hail Reaper Podcast and we create content inspired by the Red Rising universe. Check us out where ever you get your pods and listen to Pierce talk, his commentary is next level.

# Related Answers Section

The Red Rising series is renowned for its complex and compelling characters, and Redditors often debate which characters have the most impactful and well-developed arcs. Here are some of the favorite character arcs as discussed by Redditors:

### Sevro au Barca

Sevro's transformation from a rebellious outcast to a loyal leader is a standout. [...] "Easily Sevro for me because his development from the outcast wanking in the bushes to leading his own community of Howlers was so well executed."

"The best would be the first three books Sevro. Worst would be the last three books Sevro"

"Sevro not in S tier opinion rejected."

### Cassius au Bellona

Cassius's journey from a proud Gold to a man who loses everything but still fights for what he believes is right is highly praised.

"Favourite is Cassius, 90% for Lightbringer, his arc is done and it's fantastic"

"Best: Cassius. He loses everything and still continues to do what he believes is right. Full character growth, saves the day multiple times. KILLS FEAR." [...] "Morning Star: I loved all the characters but especially Cassius as he realized that death begets death and he stopped this cycle by forgiving Darrow."

# Hard Truths about the 2024 season and catching up with Alec Pierce: Official Podcast

Matt Taylor, Bill Brooks and Casey Vallier dive into the hard truths that have plagued the Colts in 2024 and left them outside the playoff conversation. Matt catches up with wide receiver Alec Pierce to talk about his 3rd season in the NFL which has led to career highs, the importance of explosive plays on offense and closing out the 2024 season strong.

### Hard Truths about the 2024 season and catching up with Alec Pierce: Official Podcast [...] ### Colts vs. Giants preview & catching up with Kenny Moore II: Official Podcast

Matt Taylor, Casey Vallier and Bill Brooks look at whether any of the Colts' playoff scenarios are realistic and if, most importantly, the Colts can finish the 2024 season strong with a win on Sunday over the New York Giants before hosting the Jaguars in Week 18. The guys also look at how Sunday could be another big day for Jonathan Taylor and Matt catches up with cornerback Kenny Moore II.

### Colts' playoff chances & wrapping up Titans win: Official Podcast

Jeffrey Gorman and Larra Overton take one last look back at a few things from the Colts' 38-30 win over the Tennessee Titans in Week 16 and get into the chances the Colts can actually make a playoff push down the stretch in 2024. ### Colts offseason ABCs and an update on the show: Official Podcast

Jeffrey Gorman, Larra Overton and JJ Stankevitz run through the ABCs of the Colts' offseason, hitting topics from Anthony Richardson's competition with Daniel Jones to offensive line depth and how Lou Anarumo's defense will come together in 2025. The gang also teases an announcement on what's coming up for Colts podcasts in the future.

## Interviews

# Official Podcast: Alec Pierce in Studio

Colts second round pick Alec Pierce pays a visit to the Colts radio studio with JJ Stankevitz and Jeffrey Gorman to discuss his draft journey, where he developed his competitiveness and what he's hoping to learn from Matt Ryan.

### Combine Convos: Field Yates

JJ Stankevitz and ESPN draft analyst Field Yates chat about prospects Colts fans should know at the NFL Combine and what's next for the Colts in 2025.

### Combine Convos: Cynthia Frelund [...] General manager Chris Ballard sat down with JJ Stankevitz at the NFL Annual League Meeting to discuss the strategy behind retaining the Colts' own players in free agency, the advantages of maintaining consistency on defense, expectations for Michael Pittman Jr. and Jonathan Taylor in year two of the offense and the growth he's seen in Shane Steichen as he enters his second year as a head coach.

### Marc Vandermeer talks the Houston Texans and the AFC South

Marc Vandermeer, the voice of the Texans, sits down with Matt Taylor and Casey Vallier at the NFL Combine to discuss the success of the Texans in 2023, why CJ Stroud was able to perform beyond expectations as a rookie and dives into why the future looks bright in Houston and the culture change under head coach DeMeco Ryans. [...] Chris Trapasso, NFL Draft insider from CBS analyzes the 2024 Draft class and how the Colts will be impacted by the teams picking in the top half of the first round. He also talks about the best-case scenario for the Colts at pick 15, Anthony Richardson's development with Shane Steichen, and his potential in his second season with the Colts.

### Tom Pelissero breaks down quarterback options and wide receiver depth ahead of NFL free agency

Tom Pelissero, reporter and host for the NFL Network, chats with Casey Vallier and Jeffrey Gorman at the NFL Combine and dives into the quarterback movement around the NFL this offseason, the wide receiver free agent class featuring Michael Pittman Jr., and the number of talented running backs that might be available this offseason.

data.snippet:
The Colts Show is back with JJ Stankevitz offering a quick recap of Week 13 and his thoughts on where the Colts stand in the AFC playoff race before former first-round pick Laquon Treadwell joins the pod for an insightful discussion into his career journey, how he leads within the Colts' wide receiver room and why he's come to love Indianapolis. JJ then opens The Colts Show Mailbag for a deep dive into the Colts' offensive issues on first down, and how they can go about fixing them down the stretch (23:00).

### Colts-Chiefs analysis, playoff odds & Mo Alie-Cox joins the podcast | The Colts Show [...] JJ Stankevitz is joined by Charles Arbuckle, who called several Colts games on the radio with Matt Taylor this season, to break down a position-by-position roadmap for the Colts' 2026 offseason. The guys start with a look back at the 2025 season (1:18) before looking at Daniel Jones, Riley Leonard and the QBs (5:22). JJ and Charles dig into the Colts' run game (14:49) and how Tyler Warren impacted the Colts' offense, including Josh Downs (19:21). They then look at the dilemma facing the Colts with Alec Pierce (25:39) and questions about the right side of the offensive line (28:19) before taking a look at the Colts' defense and special teams for the rest of the podcast (31:43).

### Edgerrin James on Jonathan Taylor, Indiana-Miami & media career | The Colts Show [...] On this week's episode of The Colts Show, JJ Stankevitz opens the pod with his reaction to the Colts' Week 12 loss to the Kansas City Chiefs and looks ahead to the final six games of the season and how looming matchups against the Texans and Jaguars could impact the Colts' playoff odds. JJ is then joined by tight end Mo Alie-Cox for a chat about his growth and role as a run blocker, his appreciation for Jonathan Taylor and how the 2025 Colts have been able to maintain their process amid the ups and downs of the season.
